    Rules

    Basic Rules

    1. Try to use real names on slack. People like to communicate with real people.
    2. Do not abuse anyone or offend anyone.üòß If you do so you will be banned from slack. Everyone is here to learn from each other so learn and help learn. üôÇ
    3. Use different channels according to their purpose. E.g. Use `#music` channel to talk/share about music ONLY.üíÉ üï∫
    4. Do not pollute the channels with meaningless messages.ü§¢
    5. Do not bombard anyone‚Äôs inbox with messages. They may get annoyed and we don‚Äôt want that.üòü Remember, hackers are busy. They have family, work, etc. to do. If you do not get any reply please be patient and continue with your work.
    6. When replying to a specific message or comment in any channel, try to make use of `message threads`.
      Refer: https://get.slack.help/hc/en-us/articles/115000769927-Message-threads
    7. If you are working in a team with other hackers then you can create `private` channel with your buddies and carry on your conversation there.üë®‚Äçüëß‚Äçüë¶ This will help lower noise in public channels.
    8. Follow slack basics.

    Rules To Follow When Interacting With Platform Employees

    1. When interacting with employees of #BugCrowd, #HackerOne or #Synack, please be polite and respectful.üòâ Remember, everyone here is to help each other learn and grow.
    2. Do not abuse anyone.üòß
    3. We strive hard to keep #bugbounty community connected and we want you to co-operate and make it easy for researchers to connect with platforms. So, in the end everyone will improve.üíÉ üï∫ üí∞

    Slack Basics

    • `@here` to notify members who are currently `active`. This sends a notification to all the members who are active.
      Refer: https://get.slack.help/hc/en-us/articles/202009646-Make-an-announcement
    • Reduce noise for yourself:
      Refer: https://get.slack.help/hc/en-us/articles/218551977-Reducing-noise-in-Slack
    • Replying to messages / comments via `message threads:
      Refer: https://get.slack.help/hc/en-us/articles/115000769927-Message-threads
